contents.title: Why web design
contents.subtitle: More customers, branding & efficiency
contents.text:
Most starting businesses don't have a website. But what exactly is a website, and what's its purpose? A website, created by a web designer or developer, acts as digital real estate on the internet. This makes it easier to be found and increases your customer reach throughout the internet. It's meant to promote your business, both administratively and commercially, depending on your goals.

Want to attract customers and let them easily request a quote? With a website, customers can fill out a form, after which you receive the request by email, SMS, or WhatsApp. This is just one of many options. Another example is a contact form for potential customer inquiries. You can also integrate a small CRM system for customer, user, or employee management, making everything easily organized.

In short, a website is digital real estate on the internet that increases your findability and offers various ways to make contact and strengthen your business. About 70% of businesses have a website, and potential customers are less likely to become your customer if they discover your business doesn't have a website.

contents.title: Web design process
contents.subtitle: Step by step
contents.text: Getting a professional website made takes only about 5 days. Here you'll find a step-by-step explanation of my approach to developing your site with excellent SEO. There may be variations, but what's described below gives a general overview of the process.

textTwo.textTwoContent: Want to renew your existing website?
textTwo.textTwoLinkContent: See how I can help you here

items.title: 1. Design choice
items.body: We start by choosing the design for your website. There are three possibilities: I select a design that best fits your website and niche, you choose a design yourself from a list I'll send you, or I create a completely custom design, entirely based on your wishes. If you choose a subscription with me, you'll also receive a free logo.

items.title: 3. Website development
items.body: In this phase, I develop your website, including excellent SEO, based on the two requirements mentioned above. On average, this process takes about five days. Variations can occur but are exceptional.

items.title: 2. Domain name, hosting, etc. acquisition
items.body: You choose a domain name, which can end with an extension of your choice, such as .com or .co.uk. Additionally, hosting is needed, which involves monthly costs. All necessary purchases, such as the domain name and hosting, are handled by me if you take out a subscription with me; you don't have to do anything or pay anything for that. I also take care of invoicing for such matters. You always remain the owner, I act as manager.

items.title: 4. Final stage
items.body: Your website is developed and linked to your purchased domain name. I put the website online and voilà, your site is ready! Additionally, I ensure your website is always updated and maintained if you choose a subscription, and I offer 24/7 support for any questions or comments you have. Want to make changes? No problem, I'm happy to take care of that, and you can always contact me for expansions!

contents.title: Example website
contents.subtitle: Example Sections & functionalities
contents.text: Below you'll find an overview of example sections and functionalities included with a subscription for a professional website. These components are essential for any business website and contribute to promoting your business and attracting customers. You can customize the sections and functionalities to perfectly match your needs.

items.title: 1. Introduction (Hero)
items.description: An introduction (or 'hero') is the first section visitors see when they open your website. It contains a brief description of your business and the services you offer.

items.title: 2. About us
items.description: In the about us section, you tell more about your company, its history, mission and vision, and the people who work there.

items.title: 3. Services
items.description: In the services section, you describe the services you offer, possibly with a price list and contact form.

items.title: 4. Gallery/Portfolio
items.description: In this section, you show projects you've done in the past, with photos, videos, and customer reviews.

items.title: 5. Pricing
items.description: In the pricing section, you show the prices of your services, possibly with discounts and promotions.

items.title: 6. Customer reviews
items.description: In the customer reviews section, you show reviews from your chosen customers who have used your services. You choose which ones to display.

items.title: 7. Contact form
items.description: In the contact form section, you'll find your contact details, such as your address, phone number, email address, and a contact form where users can ask questions and/or request quotes. You'll receive notifications by email and/or SMS.

items.title: 8. Footer
items.description: The footer is the bottom section of your website, where you place your contact details, company information, social media links, and more.

contents.title: Frequently Asked Questions
contents.subtitle: Questions & answers
contents.text: Below you'll find a list of frequently asked questions about web design and websites. If you have another question, don't hesitate to contact me.

items.title: What's the average price to have a website made?
items.description: The average price for having a website made varies greatly, depending on the project's complexity, the functionalities you need, and the web designer's experience. Fortunately, with me, you only pay €49 excl. VAT or €44 per month if you choose an annual subscription. It comes with many benefits, such as a free domain name, hosting, maintenance, and support.

items.title: Can I request a quote to have a website made?
items.description: Sure, but why? When you know that for a professional website, you only pay €49 per month excl. VAT or €44 per month if you opt for an annual subscription? So you already know the price. You can start a subscription immediately by contacting me and have your website online in about 5 days. Of course, you can also contact me for more information.

items.title: What are the startup costs?
items.description: If you choose an annual subscription, you pay no startup costs. You only pay €530 per year (€44 per month). If you choose a monthly subscription, you pay a one-time fee of €180 for startup costs excl. VAT.

items.title: What is SEO?
items.description: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. It's the process of improving the quality and quantity of website traffic to a website or web page from search engines. SEO focuses on unpaid results rather than direct traffic or paid traffic. This is something I implement as standard in my websites.

items.title: What is a domain name?
items.description: A domain name is a unique name used to identify an IP address on the internet. A domain name is an address through which people can find your website on the internet. I handle the domain name for you and cover the costs. You don't need to worry about this.

items.title: What is hosting?
items.description: Web hosting is a service that allows businesses and individuals to place their website or web page on the internet. A web host, or web hosting service provider, is a company that provides the technologies and services needed for the website or web page to be viewed on the internet. I handle the hosting for you and cover the costs. You don't need to worry about this.
